etymology.description: Phono-semantic compound: semantic 聿(聿) (yù, "brush") + phonetic 規(規) (guī, "compass") added later, originally 畵(畵) without 𦘒
etymology.interpretation: The character 畫(畫) originally depicted the idea of making lines or designs using a brush, reflecting the semantic 聿(聿) (yù, "brush") aspect. The additional component 規(規) (guī, "compass") serves as a phonetic element and reinforces the notion of creating bounded or regulated art forms.
etymology.simplification: The simplified character 画 omits 𦘒 from the original 畵, retaining the central semantic of brushwork while streamlining the complexity.

examples.chinese: 他正在画风景(他正在畫風景)。
小明喜欢画动物(小明喜歡畫動物)，他的画充满生命力(他的畫充滿生命力)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎomíng xǐhuān huà dòngwù, tā de huà chōngmǎn shēngmìnglì。
examples.english: Xiaoming enjoys painting animals, and his paintings are full of vitality.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里有几幅名家画(博物館裡有幾幅名家畫)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ yǒu jǐ fú míngjiā huà。
examples.english: There are several famous paintings in the museum.
